alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 4:38AM EST until December 20 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Carroll and Oxford Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs along the west bank of the Saco River near Moat Brook Road, cutting off access to some homes. Flood waters enter agricultural lands in eastern Conway and into Freyburg. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM EST Tuesday was 17.7 feet, which occurred around 8 PM on Monday. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to recede today and fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.2 feet on 08/29/2011. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
